events.message: The policyholder reported a car collision that occurred on April 30th, detailing the damages to their vehicle and requesting claim initiation.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and confirming the incident involved a car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case promptly to assist the customer through the claim process and answer relevant questions.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and provided the policyholder with the next steps for documentation submission.
The customer was asked to submit police reports, photos of the damaged vehicle, and a copy of the medical report describing the extent of injuries.
All requested documents including accident photos, police report, and medical bills were received and verified for completeness by the agent.
An internal investigation was initiated to assess the details of the accident and evaluate the liability and extent of damages claimed.
The investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and the damages sustained in the collision qualify under the policy terms.
A settlement offer covering the repair costs and related medical expenses was presented to the policyholder for acceptance.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed appreciation for the clear communication and assistance.
The claim was officially approved by management following successful resolution of all pending inquiries and customer agreement.
The approved settlement amount was transferred to the policyholderâ€™s bank account to cover vehicle repairs and related expenses promptly.
The claim case was officially closed after confirming the customer received payment and no further issues were reported.
